intro: Randia acutidens, commonly known as the sharp-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped and have a sharp tip. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are often red when mature. Randia acutidens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
